intro: Acanthostyles, commonly known as the "twin-leaf" or "false acanthus," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, often lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in various colors. The genus includes several species, many of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. Acanthostyles plants typically thrive in moist, well-drained soils and are often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental foliage and vibrant floral displays.
